As an AI language model, I do not have a personal opinion, but I will provide you with some potential strategies that ESPN could undertake in the future to stay ahead of its competitors.

1. Embrace New Technology: ESPN could focus on developing new technology like virtual reality or augmented reality experiences for viewers to enhance the sports viewing experience.

2. Focus on Digital Content: ESPN could continue to invest in its digital content and social media presence to reach a younger audience who consume content digitally.

3. Expand Global Reach: ESPN could continue to expand its global reach by entering new markets and acquiring international sports rights like soccer or cricket.

4. Diversify Programming: ESPN could explore other sports-related programming besides just live events and news content. For instance, it could produce more documentaries or even podcasts related to sports.

5. Collaboration/Merger with Other Networks: ESPN could collaborate with or merge with other networks, similar to what they did with ABC and NBC, to expand its reach and strengthen its scale.

6. Develop Original Sports Content: ESPN could continue to develop original sports content to capture the human interest element in sports stories and provide more in-depth coverage of sports events.

These are just a few potential strategies that ESPN could undertake in the future to stay ahead of its competitors.
